title: Coleen Rooney and Rebekah Vardy 'offered court date' to settle dispute
text:

Judge Rinder has offered warring WAGs Coleen Rooney and Rebekah Vardy the chance to settle their dispute once and for all.

The TV judge has offered to be the arbitrator between the feuding footballer's wives using his no-nonsense approach and rigorous cross-examination abilities.

Wayne Rooney's wife accused Rebekah, who is married to Jamie Vardy, of selling stories about her to national newspapers, something she denies.

Rob Rinder, speaking at the Daily Mirror's Pride of Britain Awards, said: "If Coleen and Rebekah would both like to contact me then I would be more than happy to have them in my courtroom (on his TV show).

"I would listen to both sides of the story and the evidence before me and then make a decision and settle this matter once and for all."

(Image: Mirrorpix via Getty Images)

Coleen, who has been nicknamed Wagatha Christie in the scandal, planted false stories on her private Instagram account and revealed in an epic statement that she'd blocked every account but Rebekah's from viewing her Instagram Stories to test whether or not the information would leak.

And when they did, she told the world what had happened in a bombshell statement that went viral.

(Image: Getty Images)

Rebekah has vehemently denied leaking stories about Coleen and said in her own statement that it was "disgusting" that she even had to deny it, especially when she's heavily pregnant.

Rinder added: "I can't really comment on what's gone on because I need to remain impartial if I'm going to arbitrate.

"With Halloween coming up though, I have been thinking about whether I dress up as either Coleen or Rebekah!".
description: Judge Rob Rinder has offered to be the arbitrator between the feuding footballer's wives
